summary.para: This component enables control over properties attached to AudioSource components for spatial sound in Unity.
Bypass Unity's curves.
A distance scalar for how much distance it takes for attenuation to take a target effect.
Greatest possible gain.
Lowest possible gain.
Describes room size to for audio effects.
Describes room size to for audio effects.
The base class for all spatial mapping components.
A Read-Only property that specifies whether or not collision data will be generated when computing the surface mesh's triangulation.
The extents of the bounding box from its center.
Specifies if the component should listen and respond to spatial surface changes.
The level of detail that should be used when generating surface meshes.
The number of frames to keep a surface mesh alive before destroying it after the system has stated that its real world counter part has been removed.
The amount of time between system queries for changes in physical space.
The radius of the bounding sphere volume.
The gameobject that should be the parent of all the component's surface mesh game objects.
The surface observer volume to use when querying the system for changes in physical space.
The number of triangles per cubic meter or level of detail that should be used when creating a surface mesh.
Generates surface meshes with the maximum amount of triangles.
Generates surface meshes with as few triangles as possible.
Generates a medium quality surface mesh.
The surface observer volume type to use when querying the system for changes in physical space.
An axis aligned bounding box volume.
A sphere bounding volume.

Creates and manages the game objects that represent spatial surfaces. A mesh filter and mesh collider will automatically be added to these game objects so that holograms can interact with physical surfaces.
Enables/Disables mesh collider components on all spatial surfaces associated with the SpatialMappingCollider component instance.
Sets the layer on all spatial surfaces associated with the SpatialMappingCollider component instance.
Sets the physical material on all spatial surfaces associated with the SpatialMappingCollider component instance.

Creates and manages the game objects that represent spatial surfaces. A mesh filter, mesh renderer, and material will automatically be added to these game objects so that the spatial surface can be visualized.
Controls which material will be used when rendering a surface mesh.
A material that can be used to visualize the spatial surface.
A material applied to all surface meshes to enable occlusion of holograms by real world objects.
Specifics how to render the spatial surfaces associated with the SpatialMappingRenderer component instance.
A material to use to visually render the spatial surface.
Disables all mesh renderers associated with the SpatialMappingRenderer component instance.
An occlusion material.
